Title: Provision of GDPR Support Framework Agreement (KMCLFM004)
Description: The introduction of the General Data Protection Regulation has meant that Kirklees Council and its associated agencies (Contracting Authorities) require support with their Information Governance activities. As such the Contracting Authority wishes to establish a Framework Agreement to access the support it requires, in order to enable the achievement of GDPR compliance across the Council and all associated agencies. The agencies associated with the Council include Maintained Schools and Academy Trusts (160+ organisations), Town and Parish Councils (5 organisations) and Housing Service Providers (2 organisations). All of these agencies operate with a significant amount of Personal Data and therefore require support with their GDPR implementation. The Framework Agreement has 8 Lots; 1. GDPR transition services 2. Data Processor Management - including Data Flow Mapping and Record Of Processing Activity 3. Privacy Practices - including DPIA's 4. Information Architecture and Records Management 5. Information Security Practices and Incident Management 6. Data Protection Framework including Policies and Procedures 7. Data Protection Training 8. Data Protection Officer Services It is anticipated that the GDPR Support Framework Agreement will commence on the 1st November 2018 and will expire on 31st October 2020 (with the option to extend for a further period or for successive periods up to 31st October 2022).

Title: Social Housing Routine Legal Services
Description:
emh group seek to engage with one provider for legal services in relation to social housing provision and support.  
To include - but not limited to:
-	Tenancy related - ASB, Tenancy Agreements, Complaints, Rent & Service Charges, Access Issues, Arrears, Leaseholders
-	Property related -  Right to Buy, Environmental, Disposals, Improvements, Disrepair
-	Health & Safety - Employees, Contractors
-	Care & Support - Agency Agreements, Licences, Support Agreements, Power of Attorney, 
-	Procurement -  PCR, Contracts
Attachments: PQQ Evaluation Brief.docx Legal Services Tender Brief.docx Tender Portal Instructions.docx
Additional Text:
Provider Specification/Requirements
An established UK Law firm,  who are able to demonstrate provision of the required services to a number of Registered Housing Providers. You will be proactive and recognised  in the Housing Sector - it is likely you have a team dedicated to our sector.
Expiring contracts have achieved efficiency gains (internal improvements and cost reductions) for EMH Group and this is expected to be continually achieved. 
EMH Group are therefore looking to find good calibre providers who will encourage, through education and coaching, EMH Group staff to become more self reliant and consistent across the Group in order to reduce the need for legal services and hence costs.

Title: Provision of Legal Services
Description: The Group has set up a framework to enable staff to procure legal advise in a consistent and cost effective manner. Regenda Limited (trading as Regenda Homes) is the largest stock holding entity with 2 subsidiaries; Redwing Living which focuses on shared ownership, private/market rent, commercial and outright sale. Redwing's subsidiary is McDonald Property Rentals Limited, a lettings agency in Lancashire. M&Y Maintenance and Construction Limited is a direct subsidiary of Regenda Homes and is the repairs and maintenance provider. The legal services  broadly cover Governance & Strategy, HR, Property Matters, Tenancy Matters including Leasehold, Supported Housing and Development. The framework will run for 3 years with a possible extension of a further 1 year. This procurement has been carried out in-line the requirements of the light touch regime.
Contact Address 1: Regenda House, Enterprise Business Park, Northgate Close

Title: CA4435 - Legal Services Framework
Description:
The Contracting Authority wishes to establish a Framework Agreement for the provision of Legal Services. It is being established to meet the needs of Crescent Purchasing Consortium Members, http://www.thecpc.ac.uk/members and is also open for use by all contracting authorities across the public sector throughout the UK (and any future successors to these organisations). These include (but not limited to) central government departments and agencies, Non Departmental Public Bodies, NHS bodies, Local Authorities, Police Authorities, Emergency Services, Educational Establishments, Hospices, Registered Charities, National Parks and Registered Social Landlords. The Framework is being let across thirteen regional Lots and one National One-Stop-Shop lot. Full details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas is available at http://www.npg-ltd.com/tenders/. There will be a maximum of six suppliers awarded a place on each of the fourteen Lots.

Includes Lots: 
Lot 10: Wales
Lot 13: Channel Islands
Lot 11: West Midlands
Lot 1: East Anglia
Lot 8: South East England
Lot 5: North East England
Lot 4: Northern Ireland
Lot 2: East Midlands
Lot 9: South West England
Lot 6: North West England
Lot 7: Scotland
Lot 12: Yorkshire
Lot 14: National One-Stop-Shop
Lot 3: London

To access this competition: 

Registered:
Login to https://suppliers.multiquote.com and view the opportunity CA4435.

Not registered:
Visit https://suppliers.multiquote.com then register and quote CA4435 as the reason for registration. 

 Any queries please contact MultiQuote on 0151 482 9230.

Title: Legal Services Framework
Description:
Halton Housing Trust (HHT) sought to establish a framework of multiple service providers to provide legal services to the organisation. The framework covers the following lots:
- Lot 1: Property
- Lot 2: Human Resources and Employment
- Lot 3: Corporate and Funding
- Lot 4: Housing Management

Bidders could bid on one or more lots. The outcome of the tender process was a four year framework agreement and successful bidders will be required to provide a range of legal services to HHT.

The total estimated value of the framework agreement is approximately £400,000 (ex-VAT) over the total duration of the framework based on historical expenditure. The estimated expenditure values are for information only. No guarantees are given, nor are implied as to the value or quantity of business that will be placed with the successful bidders. HHT accepts no liability for any inaccuracies in the estimates provided. 

Award of a position on this framework to any service provider does not guarantee any contracts will be awarded to that service provider. 

If face to face contact is required, this will generally need to be provided at the main HHT office.  Services may also be required wherever HHT has an operational requirement throughout the UK, especially in the areas of Widnes and Runcorn.

Title: Provision of Legal Services for Insurance Claims Handling Framework
Description: The Council require specialist external legal support to handle, investigate and administer litigated liability and motor claims. Some pre-litigated cases are also handled by external legal partners dependent on the complexity of the issues of the case or in peak periods of workflow for the internal team. Pre-litigation claims are most usually Social Care and Disease.
